articles.description: Chelsea winger Mykhailo Mudryk has failed a drugs test, with an "adverse finding" in a routine urine sample, the club confirms.
articles.title: Mykhailo Mudryk: Chelsea winger fails drugs test

articles.description: England win their first women's Test since 2014 with a crushing 286-run victory over South Africa in Bloemfontein.
articles.title: South Africa vs England: Lauren Bell takes 4-27 to lead visitors to commanding victory

articles.description: Former Porto boss Vitor Pereira agrees an 18-month deal to become Wolves' new manager.
articles.title: Wolves agree deal for Vitor Pereira to become new boss

articles.description: Jacob Bethell has given England a selection decision to make, says head coach Brendon McCullum.
articles.title: Jacob Bethell gives England 'headache', says Brendon McCullum

articles.description: Tottenham's Rodrigo Bentancur will serve the final two matches of his seven-match ban after the FA dismisses his appeal.
articles.title: Rodrigo Bentancur: Tottenham midfielder loses appeal over ban

articles.description: Brazil legend Ronaldo announces he will run for the presidency of the country's football association and wants to "recover the prestige" of the national team.
articles.title: Ronaldo: Brazil legend to run for presidency of Confederation of Brazilian Football

articles.description: Nigeria forward Ademola Lookman encourages the youth of Africa to "turn pain to power" after being named as the continent's best player.
articles.title: Ademola Lookman: How Nigeria star became African player of the year

articles.description: Kevin Doets survives a scare in the PDC World Championship to win 3-1 against Noa-Lynn van Leuven, the first transgender player to compete in the tournament.
articles.title: PDC World Championship 2025 results: Kevin Doets defeats Noa-Lynn van Leuven

articles.description: George Furbank suffered a fractured arm in Northampton's Champions Cup win over the Bulls and could miss England's opener away to Ireland in February
articles.title: George Furbank: England full-back a doubt for Six Nations opener

articles.description: Matheus Cunha is charged with misconduct by the Football Association following Wolves' 2-1 defeat by Ipswich on Saturday.
articles.title: Matheus Cunha: Wolves striker charged with misconduct by FA
